list.name: Default Changelist
list.comment: Replaced the ArrayList in Level Objects with a LinkedList as the later wont have updating issues when multiple nodes are removed at the same time. Also created a new behaviour which avoids the player while walking around, and created a EntitySound class for each entity which makes it easier to create sounds according to the entity's animation.

task.summary: Added a Behaviour class and fixed some minor issues
Created SpriteSheet class in order to animate images efficiently and autonomously

Fixed some collision issues, added healthbars, UI boxes, editable images and now multiple Behaviours can now be stacked to create a new class called Personality. To do this just do obj.setPersonality(behaviour1+behaviour2+behaviour3+...+behaviourN). This facilitates the creation of complex enemy behaviour just by adding a few basic behaviours on each other.

Fixed some collision issues, added healthbars, UI boxes, editable images and now multiple Behaviours can now be stacked to create a new class called Personality. To do this just do obj.setPersonality(behaviour1+behaviour2+behaviour3+...+behaviourN). This facilitates the creation of complex enemy behaviour just by adding a few basic behaviours on each other.
EDIT: Forgot to commit one extra file :v

Added animations, some preset images and spritesheets, fixed some ArrayList issues, added new entity, also added options to tile images infinitely and now behaviours have secondary behaviours, these are made so that if the primary behaviour is disabled or stops running because X or Y reason, the secondary replaces the primary one and runs (A good example is: when an enemy looses a player, it disables the followPlayer behaviour and runs the moveBackAndForthH instead). Secondary behaviours can be added using a ~ after the primary behaviour, example: obj1.setPersonality(Behaviour1+(Behaviour2~SecondaryBehaviour)+Behaviour3), notice the parenthesis around Behaviour2 and SecondaryBehaviour, this is EXTREMELY important to avoid issues, such as SecondaryBehaviour getting mixed with Behaviour3.

Added hitboxes, a clone method for personalities, a new enemy, and fixed alot of issues in the obj physics
New issues: Objects with custom Mask dimensions will go thru other objects if they collide with them, but not of the collision was from the left nor up

SOUNDS! Created a sound system from scratch. Now sounds can be played by creating a new instance of Sound() choosing the file path of the sound and writing sound.play(). Sounds also have panning and volume features, I also created a method where the sounds come out from different speakers depending on the play location (NOTE: This only works on some systems like Windows, if the system is not supported, it will simply try a different approaching by controlling the volume). I also fixed some collision issues and added a new method for custom image sizes and level backgrounds (setting the level background seems to lag so the method responsible for it, is commented and disabled).

SOUNDS! Created a sound system from scratch. Now sounds can be played by creating a new instance of Sound() choosing the file path of the sound and writing sound.play(). Sounds also have panning and volume features, I also created a method where the sounds come out from different speakers depending on the play location (NOTE: This only works on some systems like Windows, if the system is not supported, it will simply try a different approaching by controlling the volume). I also fixed some collision issues and added a new method for custom image sizes and level backgrounds (setting the level background seems to lag so the method responsible for it, is commented and disabled).
EDIT: Added projectiles and remade the animation class. The old animation class is now named Animation_DELETE_PENDING, the class was not deleted in case there are any references to it in the project. As soon as the references are removed and the animations migrate to the new class, it'll be deleted, for now, it stays as a deprecated class.
Current Issues: Since the object updates run in parallel, the arrayList tends to crash due to performing various operations at the same time <<NEEDS FIXING ASAP

Replaced the ArrayList in Level Objects with a LinkedList as the later wont have updating issues when multiple nodes are removed at the same time. Also created a new behaviour which avoids the player while walking around, and created a EntitySound class for each entity which makes it easier to create sounds according to the entity's animation.

MESSAGE.value: Lexer fully working, Parser on the works. Base code in Scala fully working (Gabriel Soto), adding levels currently (Zhaotian Wu).
Added a Behaviour class and fixed some minor issues
Created SpriteSheet class in order to animate images efficiently and autonomously

Fixed some collision issues, added healthbars, UI boxes, editable images and now multiple Behaviours can now be stacked to create a new class called Personality. To do this just do obj.setPersonality(behaviour1+behaviour2+behaviour3+...+behaviourN). This facilitates the creation of complex enemy behaviour just by adding a few basic behaviours on each other.

Secondary behaviours can be added using a ~ after the primary behaviour, example: obj1.setPersonality(Behaviour1+(Behaviour2~SecondaryBehaviour)+Behaviour3), notice the parenthesis around Behaviour2 and SecondaryBehaviour, this is EXTREMELY important to avoid issues, such as SecondaryBehaviour getting mixed with Behaviour3.

Added hitboxes, a clone method for personalities, a new enemy, and fixed alot of issues in the obj physics
New issues: Objects with custom Mask dimensions will go thru other objects if they collide with them, but not of the collision was from the left nor up

Sounds also have panning and volume features, I also created a method where the sounds come out from different speakers depending on the play location (NOTE: This only works on some systems like Windows, if the system is not supported, it will simply try a different approaching by controlling the volume). I also fixed some collision issues and added a new method for custom image sizes and level backgrounds (setting the level background seems to lag so the method responsible for it, is commented and disabled).

SOUNDS! Created a sound system from scratch. Now sounds can be played by creating a new instance of Sound() choosing the file path of the sound and writing sound.play(). Sounds also have panning and volume features, I also created a method where the sounds come out from different speakers depending on the play location (NOTE: This only works on some systems like Windows, if the system is not supported, it will simply try a different approaching by controlling the volume). I also fixed some collision issues and added a new method for custom image sizes and level backgrounds (setting the level background seems to lag so the method responsible for it, is commented and disabled).
EDIT: Added projectiles and remade the animation class. The old animation class is now named Animation_DELETE_PENDING, the class was not deleted in case there are any references to it in the project. As soon as the references are removed and the animations migrate to the new class, it'll be deleted, for now, it stays as a deprecated class.
Current Issues: Since the object updates run in parallel, the arrayList tends to crash due to performing various operations at the same time <<NEEDS FIXING ASAP

Replaced the ArrayList in Level Objects with a LinkedList as the later wont have updating issues when multiple nodes are removed at the same time. Also created a new behaviour which avoids the player while walking around, and created a EntitySound class for each entity which makes it easier to create sounds according to the entity's animation.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: Replaced the ArrayList in Level Objects with a LinkedList as the later wont have updating issues when multiple nodes are removed at the same time. Also created a new behaviour which avoids the player while walking around, and created a EntitySound class for each entity which makes it easier to create sounds according to the entity's animation.
